msContents.summary: Tax register, recording day by day the collection of money taxes.

msItemStruct.note: Pub. status: Recto; Verso is blank
+ P.Cair. Inv. 57187; P.Iand. VII, 141; P.Mich. Inv. 2830; 3159; 4910

condition.ab: Regularly cut at the left and right hand sides. Although the papyrus is broken at the left hand side no much is lost. kollesis at the middle of col. 135. Spots of salt can be seen on the Recto and Verso. No restoration is needed. (MA)

handDesc.p: Written in a quick but clear cursive. The scribe separated the new entry from the preceding one by underlining the name of the taxpayer.

origin.origPlace: Karanis, Herakleidou meris, Arsinoite nome, province of Egypt
origin.persName: Aphrodisios, son of Ptolemaios, grandson of Petheus, mother Tapetesouchos (see P.Mich. IV/2, p. )
Perigenes, son of Zoilos, grandson of Ptolemaios, mother Sambathion (see P.Mich. IV/2, p. 208)
Onnophris, son of Pasoknopaios, grandson of Petsiris, mother Heras (see P.Mich. IV/2, p. 191)
Hatres, son of Apollonios, grandson of Heraklas, mother Taorsenouphis (see P.Mich. IV/2, p. 156)
Onnophris, son of Onnophris, grandson of Sambas, mother Thermouthis (see P.Mich. IV/2, p. 191)
Euhemeros, son of Neilos, grandson of Euhemeros, mother Taeuhemeros (see P.Mich. IV/2, p. 164)
Petaus, son of Petalos, grandson of Petaus, mother Taeuhemeros (see P.Mich. IV/2, p. 209)
Petheus, son of Didymos, grandson of Maron, mother Tauris (see P.Mich. IV/2, p. 201)
Petesouchos, son of Hatres, grandson of Petheus, mother Tapetheus (see P.Mich. IV/2, p. 210)
Sabinus, son of Petheus, grandson of Phanomgeus, mother Herakleia (see P.Mich. IV/2, p. 222)
Ptolemaios, son of Doras, grandson of Apollonios, mother Tauris (see P.Mich. IV/2, p. 216)
Petaus, son of Herieus, grandson of Petaus, mother Tremenesis (see P.Mich. IV/2, p. 208)
Petheus, son of Sambathion, grandson of Sambathion, mother Tathautis (see P.Mich. IV/2, p. 204)
Petaus, son of Pnepheros, grandson of Phanomgeus, mother Thaesis (see P.Mich. IV/2, p. 209)
Leonides, son of Ptolemaios, grandson of Pnepheros, mother Heras (see P.Mich. IV/2, p. 184)
Herakles, son of Sokrates, grandson of Phasis, mother Tapetheus (see P.Mich. IV/2, p. 168)
Sarapion, slave of Syros alias Ptolemaios, grandson of Thaisas (see P.Mich. IV/2, p. 225)
Patron, son of Sokmenis, grandson of Sokmenis, mother Taonnophris (see P.Mich. IV/2, p. 200)
Besis, son of Petheus, grandson of Akousilaos, mother Thermouthis (see P.Mich. IV/2, p. 159)
Pnepheros, son of Ptolemaios, grandson of Onnophris, mother Tkollainis (see P.Mich. IV/2, p. 213)
Heraklas, son of Leonides, grandson of Kastor, mother Thaisas (see P.Mich. IV/2, p. 166)
Leontas, son of Ptolemaios, grandson of Ptolemaios, mother Kastorous (see P.Mich. IV/2, p. 184)
Harpalos, son of Apion, grandson of Harpalos, mother Valeria (see P.Mich. IV/2, p. 155)
Ninis, son of Asklas, grandson of Ninis, mother Tabous (see P.Mich. IV/2, p. 191)
Ptolemaios, son of Agathos Daimon, grandson of Petheus, mother Stiynchis (see P.Mich. IV/2, p. 216)
Sambas, son of Peteesis, grandson of Apollonios, mother Tanomgeus (see P.Mich. IV/2, p. 223)
Herieus the son, mother Tapapeis (see P.Mich. IV/2, p. 163)
Ptolemaios, son of Satabous, grandson of Petheus, mother Aphrodous (see P.Mich. IV/2, p. 220)

provenance.p: Karanis, Herakleidou meris, Arsinoite nome, province of Egypt

taxonomy.desc: APIS keywords are controlled locally at the institution level. They are not necessarily consistent.
